medical_history.chief_complaint: Nausea, decreased appetite, and chills following treatment for intra-abdominal abscess.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient was directly admitted with rigors and fever, found to have a 5 cm abscess under the diaphragm. The abscess was drained, and initially improved but later experienced nausea, decreased appetite, and chills without fever or emesis several days after discharge.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Lupus, Hypertension (HTN), Chronic steroid use (prednisone for many years), Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (DM2), Spinal stenosis, Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD), History of Cerebrovascular Accident (CVA) with some residual weakness, S/P Carotid Endarterectomy (CEA), Neurogenic bladder, Diverticulosis.
medical_history.family_history: Father with esophageal cancer, Family history of CVA, brother with Coronary Artery Disease (CAD).
